summary: Email correspondence between attorney Michael Bachner and a prosecutor regarding an attorney proffer meeting for an unnamed client. The emails discuss confirming details about the client's visits to Jeffrey Epstein's properties, including a Paris apartment, and establish the legal protections (Fed. R. Evid. 410, Fed. R. Crim. P. 11(f), and Rule 408) under which the proffer statements are made.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed client, corresponding with a prosecutor to confirm details from an attorney proffer meeting regarding visits to Epstein properties and the legal protections for the proffer.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Meeting
events.description: A meeting where attorney Michael Bachner made preliminary statements on behalf of his client regarding the client's knowledge or involvement, with the understanding that statements were protected under FRE 408 and 410.

keyFacts: An attorney proffer was made on February 13, 2020, with statements intended as preliminary and subject to refinement after document review.
The proffer statements were made under the protections of Fed. R. Evid. 410, Fed. R. Crim. P. 11(f), and Rule 408.

The correspondence seeks to clarify whether the attorney's client visited specific Epstein properties beyond the New York mansion and Palm Beach residence, including the Paris apartment, New Mexico ranch, and Epstein's private islands.
The client reportedly stayed in the Paris apartment with an unnamed individual on one occasion.
The document is legally privileged attorney-client communication regarding an ongoing investigation or legal proceeding.
